an5.250:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of placing faith in an individual.
an5.250:1.3: The individual to whom a person is devoted falls into an offense such that the Saṅgha suspends them.
an5.250:1.5: ‘This person dear and beloved to me has been suspended by the Saṅgha.’
an5.250:1.6: They lose much of their faith in mendicants.
an5.250:1.7: So they don’t frequent other mendicants,
an5.250:1.8: they don’t hear the true teaching,
an5.250:1.9: and they fall away from the true teaching.
an5.250:1.10: This is the first drawback in placing faith in an individual.
an5.250:2.1: Furthermore, the individual to whom a person is devoted falls into an offense such that the Saṅgha makes them sit at the end of the line. …
an5.250:2.8: This is the second drawback in placing faith in an individual.
an5.250:3.1: Furthermore, the individual to whom a person is devoted departs for another region … disrobes … passes away.
an5.250:3.3: ‘This person dear and beloved to me has passed away.’
an5.250:3.4: So they don’t frequent other mendicants,
an5.250:3.5: they don’t hear the true teaching,
an5.250:3.6: and they fall away from the true teaching.
an5.250:3.7: This is the fifth drawback in placing faith in an individual.
an5.250:3.8: These are the five drawbacks of placing faith in an individual.”
